title: Ticket #1328: minor fixes from code review of the collector.
description: Upon a recent code review some long standings potential bugs were uncovered. This is just a catch all to cleanup those issues, as well as others.
remarks:
Added more comments then anything, there is a lot of room for optimization and cleanup.

In general what I'm seeing is that a lot of the daemons could benefit greatly from a couple of simple idioms/patterns. The idea that a "controller" operates on a pristine interface behind which lies an the actual Impl is super simple and would allow us to refactor code, and hook up new impls very easily.

The controller would isolate all the Daemon-core oddities and dependencies while the inteface & impl only care about it's domain. Right now the collector has a blending of knowledge, and the encapsulation boundaries and quite sloppy.

Who maintains the data? who queries the data? who handles communications?

You simply can't point to one object to answer any of those questions.

Also, upon re-inspection of makehash functions I agree with it's "correctness".
